item.name: Retrieve a list of all registered providers (e.g., financial institutions)

header.description: (Required) Unique ID (defined by the caller) which will be reflected back in the response.
(Required) Name and version of the of the Client software

query.description:
ALL  = Embed all assets as base64
LOGO = Embed all logos as base64
NONE = No emedded assets

request.description: Returns a list of providers with information regarding software and supported use cases. (SCOPE: SIX)

response.name: List of providers

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
(Required) Unique ID (defined by the caller) which will be reflected back in the response.
(Required) Name and version of the of the Client software
Reflects the ID (set by the caller) from the request.
The header value is always PLATFORM

response.name: Bad Request - The format of the request was invalid.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
(Required) Unique ID (defined by the caller) which will be reflected back in the response.
(Required) Name and version of the of the Client software
always en
Reflected client defined ID from request.
Indicates whether the response was created by the bLink platform or by the provider. (SCOPE: SIX)

response.name: Unauthorized - Either no token or an invalid (e.g., token expired) token was received.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
(Required) Unique ID (defined by the caller) which will be reflected back in the response.
(Required) Name and version of the of the Client software
always en
Reflected client defined ID from request.
Indicates whether the response was created by the bLink platform or by the provider. (SCOPE: SIX)

response.name: Forbidden - A valid OAuth Token was received, but access was denied. (Depending on the security requirements, providers can return 404 instead)

always en

response.name: Returns a list of authorized accounts.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
(Required) Bearer followed by a base64 encoded OAuth access token
(Required) This contains the permission Id returned by the post permission, which was performed prior to any request.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!-- XML example cannot be generated -->

header.description: (Required) Name and version of the of the Client software
(Required) IP address of the user initiating the operation or AUTO for system triggered processes (SCOPE: SIX required)
(Required) User agent of the user initiating the operation or AUTO for system triggered processes (SCOPE: SIX required)

query.description: An opaque string value used for pagination
Maximum number of items to return.

request.description: This endpoint returns a highlevel list of customers and the respective accounts accessible for the logged in user. Paging is done based on the customerOverview object, i.e. if limit is set to 1, then 1 customerOverview will be returned per page.

header.description: (Required) Name and version of the of the Client software
(Required) IP address of the user initiating the operation or AUTO for system triggered processes (SCOPE: SIX required)
(Required) User agent of the user initiating the operation or AUTO for system triggered processes (SCOPE: SIX required)

query.description: An opaque string value used for pagination
Maximum number of items to return.

request.description: Returns a list of all customers. A customer is an object which holds a contract with a (custody-)bank. Paging is done based on the customer object, i.e. if limit is set to 1, then 1 customer will be returned per page.

header.description: (Required) Name and version of the of the Client software
(Required) IP address of the user initiating the operation or AUTO for system triggered processes (SCOPE: SIX required)
(Required) User agent of the user initiating the operation or AUTO for system triggered processes (SCOPE: SIX required)

query.description: An opaque string value used for pagination
Maximum number of items to return.

request.description: Returns all open orders to which the user of the API has access to. Paging is done based on the completeOrder object, i.e. if limit is set to 1, then 1 completeOrder will be returned per page.
